snippet.title: South Australian State Library evacuated
snippet.content: The South Australian State Library was evacuated for a short time on Thursday after paint fumes from a restoration project caused library patrons to feel ill. The Metropolitan Fire Service said several people were treated at the scene by ambulance crews. The MFS tracked the source of a problem to paint primer fumes which had spread through the air conditioning system, and used specialist equipment to ventilate the building. (C) AAP 2017
